issues.description: The UML in the problem statement specifies getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor(): double (returns a double) but the solution implementation defines getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor() with return type int. This is a structural return-type mismatch: students following the UML (or tests that expect a double) would implement a method returning double, while the provided solution uses int. The discrepancy can cause rounding/truncation of the students-per-tutor value and will lead to failing tests or confusion about the intended return type.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the implementation with the UML by changing the method signature and implementation to return a double. For example, in Lecture.java change the method signature to public double getNumberOfStudentsPerTutor() and compute using floating-point division, e.g. return (double) getTotalNumberOfStudents() / getNumberOfTutors();. Also update the template comments/signature or any tests to expect a double return type so all artifacts are consistent.
